page.title: 02PORTHMADOG CLIMATE
page.content: The climate of this area is mild but rather damp.The average winter temperature is 6 degrees Celsius and the average summer temperature is 16.There are about 40 inches of rainfall annually.However to compensate ,there is little frost or snow and thick fogs are almost unknown.The prevailing winds are mild and moist westerlies and the effect of the Gulf Stream is to protect the land and sea from extremes of temperature. The best times of the year are usually spring and autumn,which are often mild and fine.There is little or no air pollution as is shown by the many mosses and lichens growing in the area.
